Moreover, the hill stations near Jaipur are a perfect combination of calm vibe and beauty. In addition to it, visiting these hill stations is quite affordable. Further, trekking, water rafting and abundant natural elements will fill your heart with a sense of satisfaction and enthusiasm. The following segment will provide insight into these popular hill stations. Team Digit What Are the Top Hill Stations Near Jaipur Known as the "pink city", Jaipur itself is a perfect holiday destination that attracts a huge number of travellers throughout the world. However, the hill stations around the city are also worth visiting. Towards the north, visitors can explore the hill regions of the great Himalayan ranges, while to the southwards, the hill stations of Vindhya and Aravalli range. Some popular hill stations of these ranges are as follows - 1. Ranakpur |Approx. 357.6 kms source: tourism-of-india Situated in Rajasthan, Ranakpur is one of the nearest hill stations near Jaipur. The hill station is surrounded by the Aravalli range and has a historical connection with the Rajput Empire. In addition, the lush greenery of the region gives you a soothing experience. Best Time to Visit: October to Mid-march Top Things to Do: Trekking, wildlife visiting, camel safari, nature walk Top Places to Visit: Mucchal Mahavir Temple, Sadri, Ranakpur Jain Temple, Surya Narayan temple Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 11853 (4 days/5 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 2. Panchkula |Approx. 470.7 kms source: indiatimes As an extension of the Himalayan range, Panchkula possesses abundant greenery and wildlife. The hill city is famous for the five ancient canals flowing in it. In addition to it, there are several beautiful gardens scattered throughout the whole region. Further, if you are a history lover, the place can be a perfect choice with its historic remains. Best Time to Visit: September to December Top Things to Do: Trekking, boating, historical places visit, religious exercises Top Places to Visit: Morni Hills, Pinjore Garden, Cactus Garden, Nada sahib Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 293759 for a family of 4 (7 days/6 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 3. Parwanoo |Approx. 490.7 kms source: wikimedia At an altitude of 2500 m, Parwanoo is an off-beat tourist destination located in the Solan district of Himachal Pradesh. The hill station is a perfect combination of nature and city life. Therefore, you will have a refreshing vibe while exploring some great instances of well-organised, industry-based urban culture. Best Time to Visit: Throughout the year Top Things to Do: Trekking, cable car riding, nature walk, visiting fruit orchard Top Places to Visit: Timber trail, Gorkha Fort, Baba Balak Temple Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 98031 for a solo traveller (7 day/6 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 4. Mount Abu |Approx. 494.0 kms source: thrillophilia Starting from the home state, Mount Abu is the most beautiful hill station in Rajasthan. Located 494 km from the city Jaipur in the lap of the Aravalli plateau, Mount Abu hill station is popular for its amazing scenic beauty. For this eye-catchy landscape, the place is called the "Kashmir of Rajasthan". In addition, the place is noteworthy for its huge number of artistic temples. Best Time to Visit: November to February Top Things to Do: Boating, spiritual exercises, trekking, hiking, camping Top Places to Visit: Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Dilwara Temples, Nakki Lake, Toad Rock, Sunset Point Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 9984 to ₹ 15145 (4 Days 3 Nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 5. Rishikesh | Approx. 506.1 kms source: .wikimedia Rishikesh is one of the most popular hill stations near Jaipur and the whole of India. The region attracts a huge number of visitors throughout the world. In addition to its heavenly beauty, there is a religious value to this place. Further, the hill station has some hidden off-beat points that attract adventure lovers. Best Time to Visit: September to March Top Things to Do: Rafting, trekking, visiting temples, bungee jumping Top Places to Visit: Triveni Ghat, Lakshman Jhula Bridge, Vashishta Gufa, Ram Jhula, Neer Garh Waterfall Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 6300 to ₹ 8653 per person (2 Days/3 Nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 6. Kasauli |Approx. 517.7 kms source: alightindia Situated at 1800 m, Kasauli is a famous nature visiting point in Himachal Pradesh. There are multiple attraction points of this hill city; however, the main one is its serenity. The destination is perfect for trekking and adventure sports. In addition to it, several temples are extremely beautiful and peaceful. Best Time to Visit: May to June Top Things to Do: Trekking, nature walk, photography, religious place visiting Top Places to Visit: Manki point, Gurkha Fort, Christ Church, Sunset Point, gilbert Trail Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 3021 to ₹ 20432 per night (2 days/1 night) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 7. Dehradun |Approx. 524.3 kms source: veenaworld This hill station is a perfect place of picturesque beauty and calm vibe that attracts travellers to spend quality time with family and friends. The place is a part of the great Himalayan range with varying vegetation and moderate climate. In addition, visitors can find out about some of the most famous educational institutions here. Best Time to Visit: March to June Top Things to Do: Sightseeing, visiting Tibetian religious temples, visiting waterfalls, water rafting Top Places to Visit: Sahastradhara, Robber's Cave, Tapovan, Lacchiwala, etc Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 2066 to ₹ 6516 per night (2 days/1 night) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 8. Lansdowne |Approx. 533.1 kms source: fairlinkgroup Located around 516 km from Jaipur, Lansdowne is famous for its quaint nature and abundant natural beauty. Situated approximately 1700 metres, the area is heaven for trekking enthusiasts. In addition, the place is also noteworthy for watching wildlife and birds. Best Time to Visit: Winter Top Things to Do: Camping, water rafting, boating, watching birds Top Places to Visit: Bhulla Tal lake, Darwan Singh Museum, St. Mary's Church, Durga Devi Temple, Corbett Tiger Reserve Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 12000 to  ₹ 15000 (4 days/3 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 9. Nainital |Approx. 546.3 kms source: clubmahindra Every other person in India is charmed by the beauty of Nainital. The place is hugely popular among tourists both as a place to relax and for adventure. Therefore, during the peak time, Nainital receives a heavy load of tourists every year from all over India. Best Time to Visit: October to February Top Things to Do: Boating, visiting temples, exploring local community market, enjoying adventure sports Top Places to Visit: Naini lake, the Mall Road, Naini Peak, Hanuman Garhi Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 24399 - ₹ 42199 (6 days/ 5 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 10. Mussoorie |Approx. 557.7 kms source: himalayashelter Mussoorie is a place for creating new stories. The region is well known for its picturesque backdrop and variety of natural elements. In addition, the weather conditions and the place's charm are extremely romantic and soothing.  Best Time to Visit: March to June Top Things to Do: Nature walk, hiking, trekking, camping Top Places to Visit: Lal Tibba Scenic Point, Company Garden, The Mall Road, Gun Hill, Nag Devta Temple, Kempty Falls, Mussoorie Heritage Centre Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 10399 to ₹ 32099 (6 nights/ 7 days) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 11. Shimla |Approx. 573.3 kms source: clubmahindra The place needs no introduction as it is a tourist sensation for its picturesque natural landscape and variety of flora and fauna. The thick forest of great Himalayan pine, oak, deodar etc. will mesmerise you. Apart from that, there are many popular sightseeing spots in Shimla. However, adventure lovers will also find some off-beat places. Best Time to Visit: May to June and December to January Top Things to Do: Riding toy train, ice skating, nature walk, trekking, camping, photography Top Places to Visit: Chadwick Falls, Mashobra, Jakhoo Hill and Temple, Himachal State Museum, Wax Museum Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 25059 - ₹ 27133 ( 7 days/ 6 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 12. Dhanaulti |Approx. 559.3 kms source: agoda If you are fond of off-beat destinations, then this quaint hamlet is perfect for you. There are several spots for adventure lovers and solo travellers. The region is perfect for solace and peace of mind. In addition to it, there are some heritage temples to satisfy your historic craving. Best Time to Visit: April to June Top Things to Do: sightseeing, adventure sports, nature walk Top Places to Visit: Deogarh Fort, Surkanda Devi Temple, Tehri dam, Dhanaulti Adventure Park Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 14999 -  ₹ 16666 (5 days/4 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 13. Shoghi |Approx. 561.0 kms source: pinimg Shoghi is a small hill hamlet situated 477 km from Jaipur. The place's scenic beauty reminds everyone of those beautiful scenes from movies and pictures. The dense forest of pine and deodar and the calm vista of valleys will soothe your body and mind. Further, the variety of wildlife attracts travellers to explore. Best Time to Visit: March to June and September to November Top Things to Do: Trekking and hiking, visiting religious places, nature walk Top Places to Visit: Kandaghat, Tara Devi Temple, Hanuman Temple Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 2943 - ₹ 10499 per night ( 2 days/ 1 night - Hotel expenses) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 14. Bhowali |Approx. 566.3 kms source: ytimg Situated at the height of 1704 m from sea level, Bhowali is a popular hill station famous for its organic product processing. The most attractive part of this hill station is the heavenly beauty of the Kumaon range. In addition to it, the local folk culture also attracts travellers to explore. Best Time to Visit: September to February Top Things to Do: Trekking, sightseeing, visiting fruit orchards Top Places to Visit: Shyamkhet Tea Garden, Kainchi Dham, Golu Devta Temple Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 2595 (2 days/1 nights - Hotel expense) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 15. Kufri |Approx. 588.0 kms source: mouthshut If you are longing for a marvellous snow view, then Kufri can be a perfect destination. Situated at 2289 m from sea level, Kufri is a hill station of Himachal Pradesh, attracting travellers from all over India. The most attractive aspect of this hill station is its authentic Himalayan weather. In addition to it, the place is a heaven to the trekkers. Best Time to Visit: December to February Top Things to Do: Trekking, horse riding, skiing Top Places to Visit: Kufri valley, Indira Tourist Park, The Himalayan Nature Park, Kufri Fun World, Fagu Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 3186 - ₹ 15771 (2 days/1 night) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 16. Mukteshwar |Approx. 593.8 kms source: goibibo Situated 473 km away from Jaipur, Mukteshwar is a perfect off-beat destination for hill station lovers. The place is the extension of the gorgeous Kumaon range therefore crammed with natural Himalayan beauty. In addition, you will see Nanda Devi, the second-highest peak in India. The calm and dreamy ambience of the hill station is perfect for removing the urban toxicity from your life. Best Time to Visit: Throughout the year Top Things to Do: Paragliding, trekking, rock climbing, nature walk Top Places to Visit: Chauli ki Jali, Bhalu Gaad Waterfalls, Mukteshwar Temple, Ramgarh Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 14699 - ₹ 16153 (3 days/2 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 17. Chail |Approx. 599 kms source: thrillophilia Chail is the summer capital of the gorgeous state of Patiala. Therefore, the region is filled with royal elegance. In addition, the picturesque landscape of the small villages attracts a huge number of travellers from the whole of India. The place is quite off-beat, but the abundance of beauty is noteworthy. Best Time to Visit: May to June Top Things to Do: Visiting historical places, camping, nature walk, forest expedition Top Places to Visit: Chail wildlife sanctuary, Gurudwara Sahib, Kali Temple, Sadhupul Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 9500 - ₹ 10326 (3 days/2 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 18. Ranikhet |Approx. 606.4 kms source: holidify Located in Uttrakhand, Ranikhet is considered a small part of heaven due to its gorgeous landscape and vast calm vista. The hill station takes pride in the eye-catchy sceneries of the great Himalayan range. In addition, the beautiful fruit gardens of this place are also noteworthy. Best Time to Visit: February to November Top Things to Do: Nature walk, jungle safari, trekking Top Places to Visit: Chaubatia Garden, Jhula Devi Temple, Haidakhan Temple, Upat Golf Course Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 14400 - ₹ 16649 per person (5 days/4 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 19. Almora |Approx. 613.3 kms source: mouthshut Located around 671km from Jaipur, Almora is a stunning hill station of Uttarakhand. The place attracts many visitors with its natural abundance and calm vistas. This hill station of the Kumaon range is also known as the temple town of the famous Nanda Devi Temple, and many others are situated here. Best Time to Visit: April to June and September to November Top Things to Do: Visiting temples, nature walks, trekking Top Places to Visit: Katarmal Sun Temple, Jageshwar Dham, Kasar Devi Temple, Zero Point Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 12000 - ₹ 13000 (5 days/4 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 20. Narkanda |Approx. 634.0 kms source: treksandtrails Narkanda is a famous hill station of Himachal Pradesh which is a part of the Shivalik ranges. Due to this reason, the region is abundant in great Himalayan flora and fauna. In addition, the city is also noteworthy for fruit orchards. Trekking enthusiasts find the place perfect to meet their desires. Best Time to Visit: November to February Top Things to Do: Visiting temples, trekking, hiking, adventure sports Top Places to Visit: Hatu peak, Stokes Farm, Hatu Mata Temple, Tanni Jubbar Lake Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 93442 (6 days/5 nights) How to Reach: By road 21. Binsar |Approx. 636.2 kms source: agoda Situated 497 km from Binsar is one of the great off-beat hill stations near Jaipur. This hill city is apt for relaxing trips and spending alone time in the lap of nature. The sky-high trees will fill your heart with amazement. In addition, its elevation of 2420 m has made it a heaven for trekkers. Best Time to Visit: October to March Top Things to Do: Paragliding, trekking, bird watching, forest safari, wildlife watching Top Places to Visit: Khali estate, Zero point, Bineshwar Mahadev Temple, Kasar Devi Temple, Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 5250 - ₹ 5585 per person (2 days / 1 night) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 22. Chopta |Approx. 662.9 kms source: himalayantop At 2680 m above sea level, Chopta is a piece of paradise near Jaipur. The hill station is famous for its variety of wildlife. Tourists can see the harmless animals roaming around the open field. In addition, frequent snowfall is a special attribute of this place. Overall, the peaceful essence of the place attracts travellers to come here and relax. Best Time to Visit: April to June Top Things to Do: Trekking, camping, watching wildlife, relaxing trip Top Places to Visit: Tungnath, Chandrashila, Ukhimath, Deoria Tal, Kanchula Korak Musk Deer Sanctuary Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 4200 per person (2 nights trek package) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 23. Uttarkashi |Approx. 663.3 kms source: thrillophilia Located 496 km from Jaipur, Uttarkashi is the entrance to Gangotri and Yamunotri pilgrimage. Therefore, the place is notable for its spiritual values. Apart from that, the soothing weather, rambling of clear rivers and natural bounty will refresh your soul. As the place has still not experienced the touch of industrialization, therefore, it has the rejuvenating purity of nature. Best Time to Visit: March to November Top Things to Do: Trekking, relaxing trip, pilgrimage Top Places to Visit: Gaumukh, Gangotri, Kedar Tal, Joshiyara, Dayara Bugyal Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 7500 for ( 6 days/5 nights) How to Reach: By air, rail, road 24. Manikaran |Approx. 745.1 kms source: tripadvisor Manikaran is a popular tourist attraction and pilgrimage centre above 1756m from sea level. Apart from the eye-catchy beauty of the place, the hot springs and amazing architecture of temples are other attraction points of the place. In addition, the weather condition is also soothing and good for health recovery. Best Time to Visit: Throughout the year Top Things to Do: Taking a bath at hot springs, religious exercises, trekking Top Places to Visit: Malana, Parvati valley, Kulant Pith, Kheer Ganga, hot springs, Shiva temple Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 6000 - ₹ 7000 per person (on twin sharing) How to Reach: By road 25. Kedarnath |Approx. 752 kms source: tripadvisor Kedarnath is one of the most visited pilgrimage spots in northern India. The hill station is in the city Rudraprayag beside the river Mandakini. The place is highly spiritual, and the breathtaking hilly landscape attracts visitors from all over the world. In addition, adventure and trekking lovers find this place apt for them. Best Time to Visit: April to June Top Things to Do: Visiting temples, trekking, adventure sport, Top Places to Visit: Vasuki Tal Lake, Bhairavnath Temple, Chandrashila, Chorabari Lake, Gaurikund, Shankaracharya Samadhi Average Cost of the Vacation: ₹ 13900 - ₹ 17000 (5 nights/ 6 days) How to Reach: By air, rail, road Visiting hill stations adds refreshment to the daily monotonous routine. If you are thinking of visiting some of the best, then the above-mentioned hill stations near Jaipur are perfect. It is necessary to have natural bliss in your life to move forward with more energy and vigour. Therefore, consider this guide to plan your next trip to the lap of soothing hill stations.
